revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-01 14:30:50.000000000', 'message': "WIP: [placement] POST /allocations to set allocations for >1 consumers

Throwing this up for early feedback and because I may not be able
to give it attention for a little while, so wanted to make sure
it was visible.

This gives a proof of concept implementation of POSTing to
/allocations to set allocations for multiple consumers, such as an
an instance and a migration uuid. Conceptually it is relatively
simple: build an AllocationList of Allocation objects and
create_al(). But there are some wrinkles:

* The association between consumer_uuid and project id is only done
  for the consumer of the first allocation, resulting in bad /usages
  data when querying by project or user

* There's no jsonschema yet. I couldn't figure out how to write one
  without a reference and was without net

* This uses a dict-based representation of allocations, based on the
  response to GET. We may wish to use a list based style, which is
  what is currently used on PUT /allocations/{consumer_uuid}, but
  see https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1708204 and comments on
  the spec review about some preference for dict

* If we fix the issue with project consumer association in
  straightforward way it ought to allow allocations from multiple
  project/user

* There are many TODOs (especially related to duplication) and
  FIXMEs scattered throughout

Change-Id: I239f33841bb9fcd92b406f979674ae8c5f8d57e3
Implements: bp post-allocations

"}, {'created': '2017-10-10 12:21:16.000000000', 'message': "[placement] POST /allocations to set allocations for >1 consumers

This provides microversions 1.12 of the placement API, giving the
ability to POST to /allocations to set (or clear) allocations for
more than one consumer uuid.

This builds on the recent work to support a dict-based JSON format
when doing a PUT to /allocations/{consumer_uuid}.

Being able to set allocations for multiple consumers in one request
helps to address race conditions when cleaning up allocations during
move operations in nova.

Clearing allocations is done by setting the 'allocations' key to an
empty dict.

Docs and reno in a subsequent patch, after we determine if this is
actually what we want.

Change-Id: I239f33841bb9fcd92b406f979674ae8c5f8d57e3
Implements: bp post-allocations
"}, {'created': '2017-10-10 13:40:43.000000000', 'message': "[placement] POST /allocations to set allocations for >1 consumers

Implements: bp post-allocations

commit_message:
[placement] POST /allocations to set allocations for >1 consumers

This provides microversion 1.13 of the placement API, giving the
ability to POST to /allocations to set (or clear) allocations for
more than one consumer uuid.

It builds on the recent work to support a dict-based JSON format
when doing a PUT to /allocations/{consumer_uuid}.

Being able to set allocations for multiple consumers in one request
helps to address race conditions when cleaning up allocations during
move operations in nova.

Clearing allocations is done by setting the 'allocations' key for a
specific consumer to an empty dict.

Updates to placement-api-ref, rest version history and a reno are
included.

Change-Id: I239f33841bb9fcd92b406f979674ae8c5f8d57e3
Implements: bp post-allocations

commit_message:
Remove 'nova-manage quota refresh' command

This command was deprecated in 16.0.0 and can now be removed.

Change-Id: I016227cb20f8d6911e3cb57c7372835a75d122fd

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-28 08:15:56.000000000', 'message': "Always generate ARA subunit results

We'd like to see our tests results show up in OpenStack Health
regardless of whether the test passed or failed. This patch
makes sure that it will always try to generate them.

It also implements a routine to try and find where ARA is
installed, because it's not always in a tox venv called
'functional' which was the previously hard-coded location.

Change-Id: I3d967567af9d9c9583f34c89789a38e60717781e
(cherry picked from commit 2fb00b67edb249d47a422434757f406926b747a0)
"}]
commit_message:
Always generate ARA subunit results

We'd like to see our tests results show up in OpenStack Health
regardless of whether the test passed or failed. This patch
makes sure that it will always try to generate them.

It also implements a routine to try and find where ARA is
installed, because it's not always in a tox venv called
'functional' which was the previously hard-coded location.

Change-Id: I3d967567af9d9c9583f34c89789a38e60717781e
(cherry picked from commit 2fb00b67edb249d47a422434757f406926b747a0)

commit_message:
Remove the deprecated TrustedFilter and related options

The TrustedFilter and the related trusted_computing config
options were deprecated in Pike:

  If6e53feeb97e6050c1eb7962110ed89504c952fc

This change removes them along with related documentation.

Change-Id: I26ce2de6435a9956d1c28e04221fa4a8d140833c

This change requires bumping python-ironicclient to 2.0.0, which is currently being released. Please make a global-requirements change and make this change depend on it.'}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2017-11-13 18:34:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

This change does not require python-ironicclient. Nova uses node.set_provision_state which already accepts any arbitrary arguments. (it also works on my side with python-ironicclient 1.3.1)

commit_message:
Regenerate and pass configdrive when rebuild Ironic nodes

Previously, the configdrive could only be set when setting
the node's provisioning state to "active". When rebuilding,
the old configdrive was used and therefore was never updated
with latest content.

Since Ironic API microversion 1.35, it is now allowed to provide
a configdrive when setting the node's provisioning state to "rebuild".

Blueprint: rebuild-ironic-config-drive
Related-bug: #1575935
Depends-On: I9a5529f9fa796c75621e9f4354886bf3032cc248
Change-Id: I1f9056f66519b9ca2f4e23143559735f2bff8943

commit_message:
Remove legacy-cinder-tox-* jobs from Cinder

These jobs are being replaced by zuul jobs defined in the Cinder tree.

Depends-On: Idb9a1f39481f3ebb704b28abc062ae24414d7224
Needed-by: I3af7771ab3e8d5a192f466dcec36a2b41db08ac3

[{'account_id': 22078, 'date': '2017-11-23 02:13:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2017-11-23 07:17:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I agree there is an issue here, but the fix may not be so easy, see inline comments'}, {'account_id': 22078, 'date': '2017-11-23 09:10:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 22078, 'date': '2017-11-23 09:15:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-11-27 00:44:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I don't see that I5140a7d83bf567b1c3c67516112eb4c57074fa53 has actually changed behaviour wrt this?

After thinking about this, I'm guessing the path to this is that devstack has set 

 GITREPO["glance_store"]=...

so you need to do LIBS_FROM_GIT+="glance_store".  But, when we try to match "glance_store" against "glance-store" as reported by install here, we miss.

So ... either we should ensure that our GITREPO entry is == to the pip name

or

if we want to translate it at this layer, i'd much prefer to see us use python to do that, something like

  local safe_name
  safe_name=$(python -c "from pkg_resources import safe_name; print safe_name('${name}')")

because this implementation gets subtle details wrong, like extended "___" strings should join to a single "-" and I think something else about "."'s messes it up too

I'm not 100% sure which is the more correct solution'}, {'account_id': 22078, 'date': '2017-11-27 02:41:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thanks four your review Ian,
Both method can fix this bug.
For method 1, I think it is the root solution. But if we  set GITREPO entry == 'glance-store' for 'glance_store' package, it may cause confusion. Besides, if we make this change, we should also modify the local.conf for param LIBS_FROM_GIT. It is a big change.
I think we can fix this bug based on method 2 firstly. 
Anyone else idea?"}, {'account_id': 22078, 'date': '2017-11-27 02:45:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 22078, 'date': '2017-11-27 02:47:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 22078, 'date': '2017-11-27 05:48:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-11-27 05:50:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 22078, 'date': '2017-11-27 06:05:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 22078, 'date': '2017-11-27 06:06:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 22078, 'date': '2017-11-27 07:47:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-11-27 20:26:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

glance_store has been in here unmodified since I2e0ed2b7fb5994ae6abd92612a67ce5fd82b3f7e and I can't really see it's been working since.

I guess this gives us the flexibility to use either the "file system" name or the safe-name so probably works out OK either way'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-11-27 20:33:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-11-27 20:35:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-11-28 05:52:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

we've broken this before because we don't have a plugin test in the gate.  can we choose something to do a depends-on to confirm this is ok please"}, {'account_id': 22078, 'date': '2017-11-28 06:23:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Hi Ian,
  The reason I upload this patch is that i was responsible for VMware OpenStack test. Our local.conf contains params 'LIBS_FROM_GIT=glance_store'. So all devstack create failed with the error " [ERROR] /tmp/workspace/ext-cinder-zuul/devstack/inc/python:437 The following LIBS_FROM_GIT were not installed correct: glance_store".
   Now, I fetch devstack for this patch. Our CI can work well. The following is an example of the result via this patch. 'http://10.148.255.241/logs/49/512949/11/check-not-vote/ext-cinder-zuul/f69eb24/'. But you can not see the HEAD of the devstack. In other words, you can't see any information about this patch on the logs. Only me can confirm our devstack use this patch for devstack creation.

I don't know if this can provide help.

Regards,
Damon Li'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-11-28 06:57:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-11-28 16:14:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-11-28 16:17:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2017-11-28 16:38:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}]

[{'created': '2017-11-23 02:13:57.000000000', 'message': 'Fix bug on lib_installed_from_git

Command 'pip list --format=columns' prints the following result for
glance_store:
  "glance-store             0.21.1.dev22      /opt/stack/glance_store"
We can see the package name for glance_store is "glance-store". So we should
not use '^' to match the package name for glance_store.

Change-Id: I30524f80a341f38dfa794a8f629d859e85a4a448
'}, {'created': '2017-11-23 09:15:49.000000000', 'message': 'Fix bug on lib_installed_from_git

replace '_' with '-' and then match the package name for glance_store.

'}, {'created': '2017-11-27 20:35:40.000000000', 'message': 'Convert to safe name in lib_installed_from_git

The 'pip list' command prints the "safe name" which converts _'s to
-'s amongst other things; e.g. glance_store becomes

  "glance-store             0.21.1.dev22      /opt/stack/glance_store"

Because people may use these more familiar "file system" names in
LIBS_FROM_GIT automatically convert names when checking if libraries
are installed.

Change-Id: I30524f80a341f38dfa794a8f629d859e85a4a448
'}]
commit_message:
Convert to safe name in lib_installed_from_git

The 'pip list' command prints the "safe name" which converts _'s to
-'s amongst other things; e.g. glance_store becomes

  "glance-store             0.21.1.dev22      /opt/stack/glance_store"

Because people may use these more familiar "file system" names in
LIBS_FROM_GIT automatically convert names when checking if libraries
are installed.

Change-Id: I30524f80a341f38dfa794a8f629d859e85a4a448

commit_message:
[placement] Clean up TODOs in allocations.yaml gabbit

With the avent of gabbi 1.35.0 (already in test-requirements),
subtitutions in the left hand side of a json path check are now allowed.
allocations.yaml had two TODOs related to this which this change fixes.

Also fixed:

* a TODO about the nature of consumer id's is changed to a NOTE since
  the behavior is as designed
* a whitespace nit is fixed, since I'm in here already may as well

Change-Id: I3bbeb2bcf0ae23467f795dc6fb4a1de46c08d3ef

[{'created': '2017-11-28 13:38:49.000000000', 'message': "Fix role schema in trust object

Previously, we weren't doing any validation on the roles attribute of a
trust except to validate that it was an array. A hasty glance, however,
would lead you to believe that it was validating an array of
parameter_types.id_string[1] and so we translated that to the new role
object validation. However, id_string doesn't include some valid role
names like _member_. This patch updates the role name schema to match
parameter_types.name, which is the same as the schema for the main role
object.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystone/tree/keystone/trust/schema.py?id=62f9e57cd81dc98c5816da9fa483d385b4c1a66c#n41

Change-Id: I83aafc7a96e81a9b6b1056b39cd8c5d23676c014
Closes-bug: #1734871

commit_message:
Fix role schema in trust object

Previously, we weren't doing any validation on the roles attribute of a
trust except to validate that it was an array. A hasty glance, however,
would lead you to believe that it was validating an array of
parameter_types.id_string[1] and so we translated that to the new role
object validation. However, id_string doesn't include some valid role
names like _member_. This patch updates the role name schema to match
parameter_types.name, which is the same as the schema for the main role
object.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystone/tree/keystone/trust/schema.py?id=62f9e57cd81dc98c5816da9fa483d385b4c1a66c#n41

Change-Id: I83aafc7a96e81a9b6b1056b39cd8c5d23676c014
Closes-bug: #1734871

'}, {'created': '2017-06-06 13:28:43.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for hybrid messaging backends

This commit separates the messaging rpc and notify transports in order
to support separate and different oslo.messaging backends

This patch:
* add rpc and notify variables
* add messaging host group to inventories
* add transport_url templates for rpc, notify
* update service role conf templates
* add release note

Implements: blueprint hybrid-messaging
Change-Id: I34691c2895c8563f1f322f0850ecff98d11b5185
'}, {'created': '2017-06-06 16:20:36.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for hybrid messaging backends

This commit separates the messaging rpc and notify transports in order
to support separate and different oslo.messaging backends

This patch:
* add rpc and notify variables
* add messaging host group to inventories
* add transport_url templates for rpc, notify
* update service role conf templates
* add release note

Implements: blueprint hybrid-messaging

commit_message:
Add support for hybrid messaging backends

This commit separates the messaging rpc and notify transports in order
to support separate and different oslo.messaging backends

This patch:
* add rpc and notify variables
* update service role conf templates
* add example to globals.yaml
* add release note

Implements: blueprint hybrid-messaging
Change-Id: I34691c2895c8563f1f322f0850ecff98d11b5185

commit_message:
tempest: Use kwargs for create_server

As create_server() method is a wrapper around create_server() for compute
API, this patch adds support to pass kwargs parameters down to compute
API.

Change-Id: I0c970944c8f4de5c00e25f37e60206717cea4761

subject: Catch socket.timeout when doing heartbeat_check
messages: [{'account_id': 4460, 'date': '2017-11-22 16:09:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13404, 'date': '2017-11-22 16:48:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2017-11-27 17:07:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2017-11-28 17:24:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-22 16:09:48.000000000', 'message': 'Catch socket.timeout when doing heartbeat_check

heartbeat_check in kombu.connection is not reraising exceptions as
exceptions.OperationalError, and the socket timeout during the heartbeat
check is really an issue seen in the field when a node goes down; the
heartbeat thread just tries again and again to deal with it, without
success.

Change-Id: I26dbdb18a7e64946db2cba676764ff2d428c7897
Closes-Bug: #1657444
(cherry picked from commit 8bfc3637a25a29583b1e0625c78bf159ac878259)
'}]
commit_message:
Catch socket.timeout when doing heartbeat_check

heartbeat_check in kombu.connection is not reraising exceptions as
exceptions.OperationalError, and the socket timeout during the heartbeat
check is really an issue seen in the field when a node goes down; the
heartbeat thread just tries again and again to deal with it, without
success.

Change-Id: I26dbdb18a7e64946db2cba676764ff2d428c7897
Closes-Bug: #1657444
(cherry picked from commit 8bfc3637a25a29583b1e0625c78bf159ac878259)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-17 18:19:40.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Add regression test for rebuild with new image doubling allocations

Commit 984dd8ad6add4523d93c7ce5a666a32233e02e34 makes a rebuild
with a new image go through the scheduler again to validate the
image against the instance.host (we rebuild to the same host that
the instance already lives on).

The problem is that change introduced a regression where the
FilterScheduler is going to think it's doing a resize to the same
host and double the allocations for the instance (and usage for the
compute node provider) in Placement, which is wrong since the
flavor is the same.

This adds a regression test to show the bug.

Change-Id: Ie0949b4e6101f0b29ec4542146d523a07a683991
Related-Bug: #1664931

commit_message:
Add regression test for rebuild with new image doubling allocations

Commit 984dd8ad6add4523d93c7ce5a666a32233e02e34 makes a rebuild
with a new image go through the scheduler again to validate the
image against the instance.host (we rebuild to the same host that
the instance already lives on).

The problem is that change introduced a regression where the
FilterScheduler is going to think it's doing a resize to the same
host and double the allocations for the instance (and usage for the
compute node provider) in Placement, which is wrong since the
flavor is the same.

This adds a regression test to show the bug.

Change-Id: Ie0949b4e6101f0b29ec4542146d523a07a683991
Related-Bug: #1664931

commit_message:
Add instance action record for lock/unlock instances

We currently don't record lock/unlock instance
actions. This is useful for auditing and debugging.

This patch adds instance lock/unlock actions.

Change-Id: I09fadf79aac1a74465af48015ef97d9e9d4ac580
partial-implements: blueprint fill-the-gap-for-instance-action-records

commit_message:
Implement query param schema for sec group APIs

sec group APIs accept query param to filter the
quota.
This commit adds json schema to validate the valid
query parameters.

There is no change in API behaviour and additionalProperties
is kept True for backward compatibility.

Partially implements blueprint json-schema-validation-for-query-param

commit_message:
[Docs] Clarify ceph production example.

There are details that confuse people (like the usage of may), when
they are configuring a ceph environment.

This should clarify the situation.

Change-Id: Ic8b734eabcfa218c687db69290c8b3cef1def7c5

commit_message:
Extend comparator support for project list by tags

This changes allows operator to use the keystoneclient to filter
projects with tags using comparators including 'startswith',
'endswith', and 'contains'.

Change-Id: Ib85e105824afb70a8dac8b5f684daef301b03786
Partially-Implements: bp project-tags
Depends-On: I00f094a5584be40ab477cbf680a5f6d1afb4d21b
Depends-On: I0983a5b592aaffa9cef38c74c038fa60a176786c
Co-Authored-By: Omar Tleimat <otleimat@ucla.edu>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-28 17:40:39.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Add package install assertions to SUSE base image"

This reverts commit 163341e624ec4d2dba39d6ac140111aa6a809baa.

The systemd from Tumbleweed is not fully functional inside the container

container1:/home/vagrant # systemctl status
Failed to connect to bus: No such file or directory

and because of that services are not working

wicked: Unable to connect to wicked dbus service", "wicked: Cannot get
dbus system bus handle (Failed to connect to socket
/run/dbus/system_bus_socket: No such file or directory)

As such, lets revert this commit until this is properly tested.

Change-Id: I2ccc941f8e961ced3d77b5e86e20d4ce29e778ee
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Add package install assertions to SUSE base image"

This reverts commit 163341e624ec4d2dba39d6ac140111aa6a809baa.

The systemd from Tumbleweed is not fully functional inside the container

container1:/home/vagrant # systemctl status
Failed to connect to bus: No such file or directory

and because of that services are not working

wicked: Unable to connect to wicked dbus service", "wicked: Cannot get
dbus system bus handle (Failed to connect to socket
/run/dbus/system_bus_socket: No such file or directory)

As such, lets revert this commit until this is properly tested.

Change-Id: I2ccc941f8e961ced3d77b5e86e20d4ce29e778ee

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-08 20:14:28.000000000', 'message': 'Fix deep_links macro in .htaccess

Because the trailing / is optional, the deep_links macro could match
multiple projects if one of their names is a prefix of the other(s)
(e.g. heat and heat-translator). It also means that completely bogus
paths will redirect to bogus locations - e.g. currently
https://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova-foo redirects to
https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/-foo

Avoid this by adding a negative-lookahead assertion, to ensure that the
path passed in by the caller of the macro is not followed by any non-/
character.

Change-Id: I9dcf5dccfa36a3b1895f4422deafcdb73b150cbd

commit_message:
Fix deep_links macro in .htaccess

Because the trailing / is optional, the deep_links macro could match
multiple projects if one of their names is a prefix of the other(s)
(e.g. heat and heat-translator). It also means that completely bogus
paths will redirect to bogus locations - e.g. currently
https://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova-foo redirects to
https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/-foo

Avoid this by adding a negative-lookahead assertion, to ensure that the
path passed in by the caller of the macro is not followed by any non-/
character.

Change-Id: I9dcf5dccfa36a3b1895f4422deafcdb73b150cbd

[{'created': '2017-11-24 10:28:40.000000000', 'message': 'Describe common quickstart and extras defaults

Add non_root_user, undercloud_key, undercloud_user, local_working_dir,
working_dir, overcloud_user and overcloud_key default values to the common
role defaults. These are shared for *multiple* quickstart and extras use cases,
like undercloud/overcloud/external deployments, virtual, barematal or OVB.

An implicit defaults for these bring confusion for quickstart users, and
complicate deployed servers customizations, like overcloud user and key and
working dir to contain the latter.

Closes-bug: #1663420
Closes-bug: #1688254
Related-bug: #1734298

Change-Id: I33ee791aee0799fdc430fdbea52db75f8ef8ef33
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Describe common quickstart and extras defaults

Add non_root_user, undercloud_key, undercloud_user, local_working_dir,
working_dir, overcloud_user and overcloud_key default values to the common
role defaults. These are shared for *multiple* quickstart and extras use cases,
like undercloud/overcloud/external deployments, virtual, barematal or OVB.

An implicit defaults for these bring confusion for quickstart users, and
complicate deployed servers customizations, like overcloud user and key and
working dir to contain the latter.

Closes-bug: #1663420
Closes-bug: #1688254
Related-bug: #1734298

Change-Id: I33ee791aee0799fdc430fdbea52db75f8ef8ef33
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

subject: Wrong handling of is_system flag at workbooks causes DB error with MySQL 5.7
messages:
[{'account_id': 23271, 'date': '2017-11-24 13:55:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21970, 'date': '2017-11-27 09:14:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7700, 'date': '2017-11-27 09:31:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

What about to set the default value in models here: 

https://github.com/openstack/mistral/blob/master/mistral/db/v2/sqlalchemy/models.py#L104

?'}, {'account_id': 21970, 'date': '2017-11-28 13:07:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> What about to set the default value in models here:
 > 
 > https://github.com/openstack/mistral/blob/master/mistral/db/v2/sqlalchemy/models.py#L104
 > 
 > ?

This may be the way forward, however, it would require an upgrade script too. Existing data may cause errors if not adjusted to meet the constraint. The current change is scoped only on the workbooks while the schema change would affect all resources that inherit from the Definition class.

This change makes the Workbook related logic conform to the existing practice. I suggest we create an enhancement ticket to clean up this part of the model.'}, {'account_id': 21970, 'date': '2017-11-28 13:08:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2017-11-28 16:09:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-24 13:55:59.000000000', 'message': "Wrong handling of is_system flag at workbooks causes DB error with MySQL 5.7

If we leave is_system workbook attribute as undefined (Null) that causes
database insert error in MySQL 5.7, due to database constraints.
So let's use constant False as is_system attribute in workbook create.
It is OK, because there is no system workbook support in mistral yet.

Change-Id: Idabf9d04d105c2386b9b110f1bbab3e69502b8e0
Closes-Bug: #1733501
"}]
commit_message:
Wrong handling of is_system flag at workbooks causes DB error with MySQL 5.7

If we leave is_system workbook attribute as undefined (Null) that causes
database insert error in MySQL 5.7, due to database constraints.
So let's use constant False as is_system attribute in workbook create.
It is OK, because there is no system workbook support in mistral yet.

Change-Id: Idabf9d04d105c2386b9b110f1bbab3e69502b8e0
Closes-Bug: #1733501

commit_message:
Skip tempest jobs for doc/* only changes

Neutron repo contains doc/ directory to store install and other guides.
We should not execute tempest jobs if a patch touches those files only.

Change-Id: If5003bb573e959a2324eab62cc08822c6e28e5f4

This uses os_workers as default for every workers config setting of the
various services.

recheck'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-10-30 04:08:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I think this is wrong, because after we EOL a branch we go through and do things like remove all the stable/* branch filters for jobs on that branch, and other external things like that.  and of course it's on borrowed time, as no fixes can be merged.  tacitly using the "branch" seems like a recipe for confusion.

if jobs *are* still running on older branches, they ought to just opt out of the EOL process and it will much clearer for everyone.'}, {'account_id': 6637, 'date': '2017-11-02 15:02:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This is required for projects that have opted out of EOLing their project for the older releases so still need to run CI against those releases to ensure there are no regressions.

Those CIs are running devstack and need to load the services in the same way is they did for stable/newton, but the majority of the projects don't have stable/newton branches so the OVERRIDE_ZUUL_BRANCH is set to "newton-eol" to ensure the right version of nova/neutron etc are loaded, and that field is what is used to set the version matrix too.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-11-06 22:00:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Sorry I'm still not 100% convinced but maybe i'm a bit slow.  why have we never required this before?  can you point me to where this is happening for your project?"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2017-11-14 23:43:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Sorry I'm still not 100% convinced but maybe i'm a bit slow.  why
 > have we never required this before?  can you point me to where this
 > is happening for your project?

As mentioned on IRC it comes down to 2 things 1) we're slightly more 'asynchronous' with the newton EOL than we have been in the past in that we have most, but not all, of the 'defcore' projects tagged and need to land changes in the untagged ones so we can tagg them  ; and 2) we're allowing for a hypothetical future where some but not all projects have longer lived stable branches."}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-11-15 20:19:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Does I344d8fdded9b7d5385fcb41b699f1352acb4cda7 help?  That will check for the "-eol" tag when preparing the checkout for devstack.  I think maybe you were thinking of a different approach where you'd set your branch to "old-eol" rather than "old"?'}, {'account_id': 6637, 'date': '2017-11-27 14:42:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Does I344d8fdded9b7d5385fcb41b699f1352acb4cda7 help?  That will
 > check for the "-eol" tag when preparing the checkout for devstack. 
 > I think maybe you were thinking of a different approach where you'd
 > set your branch to "old-eol" rather than "old"?

It doesn't because that change is only for zuul v3 part of the setup workspace code, but I can rework the two changes I have to devstack-gate to implement the same thing for zuul v2 based CIs'}, {'account_id': 6637, 'date': '2017-11-28 17:46:23.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Superceeded by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/512245'}]

[{'created': '2017-10-10 17:02:05.000000000', 'message': 'Allow EOL branches to use the test-matrix.py script

When running devstack on EOL tags the feature matrix rejects the
branch reference as unsupported even though it can actually support it.
This patch adds an additional check to the normalize function to allow
branches/references in the format "branch-eol" to be normalized and
processed correctly.

Change-Id: Ie605969bb81c97072e909b50f9e9e33c0164f900
'}, {'created': '2017-10-16 09:56:08.000000000', 'message': 'Allow EOL branches to use the test-matrix.py script

When running devstack on EOL tags the feature matrix rejects the
branch reference as unsupported even though it can actually support it.
This patch adds an additional check to the normalize function to allow
branches/references in the format "branch-eol" to be normalized and
processed correctly.

Change-Id: Ie605969bb81c97072e909b50f9e9e33c0164f900
'}]
commit_message:
Allow EOL branches to use the test-matrix.py script

When running devstack on EOL tags the feature matrix rejects the
branch reference as unsupported even though it can actually support it.
This patch adds an additional check to the normalize function to allow
branches/references in the format "branch-eol" to be normalized and
processed correctly.

Change-Id: Ie605969bb81c97072e909b50f9e9e33c0164f900

commit_message:
config: Always add step conditional first for upgrade_tasks

This is required to ensure conditionals using variables set by prior
steps are not evaluated prior to these steps running.

Closes-bug: #1732888
Change-Id: I9f6d60f22ef4c057a0d5f47ac2bd4f08520faeec
(cherry picked from commit 78a5bc0554f7571bce9794618e3c653c109a90b1)

commit_message:
Select first node as bootstrap node not using name

This fixes a regression which reintroduced bug #1640449 because
we hard-code the node index/name instead of sorting the map of servers

Change-Id: Iaffc66a41edf176dde3b5adf603a9cff6db7aa24
Closes-Bug: #1724888

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-27 22:54:36.000000000', 'message': 'Process client broker requests post bootstrap

Its possible that a remote client unit will present its broker
request prior to the Ceph MON cluster being bootstrapped; ensure
that any client-relation-changed hooks are re-executed after
bootstrap to process any pending broker requests.

Change-Id: I30123183ad3d4a0078fbb92941b2b8e8aadd6d1c
Closes-Bug: 1734620
(cherry picked from commit f5a7315c2fa7aeeb652f4825c10e1d491bd1b319)
'}]
commit_message:
Process client broker requests post bootstrap

Its possible that a remote client unit will present its broker
request prior to the Ceph MON cluster being bootstrapped; ensure
that any client-relation-changed hooks are re-executed after
bootstrap to process any pending broker requests.

Change-Id: I30123183ad3d4a0078fbb92941b2b8e8aadd6d1c
Closes-Bug: 1734620
(cherry picked from commit f5a7315c2fa7aeeb652f4825c10e1d491bd1b319)

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-06-14 21:13:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Most use the already existing san_ip and san_port for this. What would be the reason for adding new similarly named config options? Seems like it would just cause confusion.'}, {'account_id': 19576, 'date': '2017-06-15 08:01:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Yes, most of the drivers are using san_ip and san_port but the others one have specific names (because they don't use san protocol). This bp is to create generic config names to use for all of the drivers. We will remove san_ip, san_port and the specific ones and we will use the generic ones. It will be clearer not to have different names for the same config. But if it brings confusion, I can abandon this patch."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-06-15 13:04:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: -Code-Review

OK, I see what you're saying. FWIW, I like the naming of these options better than the other ones. It's just the unfortunate case that those are already well established and known.

Maybe we can discuss this in next weeks Cinder meeting. Can you attend? If so, please add this to the meeting agenda. It may be worth migrating over to these new config options for better clarity."}, {'account_id': 19576, 'date': '2017-06-19 09:35:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> OK, I see what you're saying. FWIW, I like the naming of these
 > options better than the other ones. It's just the unfortunate case
 > that those are already well established and known.
 > 
 > Maybe we can discuss this in next weeks Cinder meeting. Can you
 > attend? If so, please add this to the meeting agenda. It may be
 > worth migrating over to these new config options for better
 > clarity.

I will attend the meeting. I have added the link in the agenda."}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2017-06-21 07:30:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2017-06-21 16:31:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2

So not a bad idea in general, but.. here's the thing.  We already have a general config option for this "san_ip", granted maybe the name isn't generic enough for everybody, or everybody wants to be a snow-flake and use their own custom name, but we do have this config option already.

If we want to change the name of the option from sna-ip to api-server-ip that's a different discussion, and the patch and bp should make it clear that that's what we're doing as well as deprecating the san_ip config option and replacing it.  Otherwise we're just introducing yet another duplicate config option.

The bigger question/problem is all of the custom config options introduced by drivers that don't want to use a generic config option.  We should probably discuss if it's worthwhile to consolidate all of the overlapping configs into general ones where we can and deprecate/migrate those options.

Keep in mind this is a problem in terms of upgrades at some point where it requires manual updates for drivers that are installed in clouds that are upgraded.'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2017-06-21 16:43:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-11-28 16:32:17.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Superceded'}]

commit_message:
Add new options in volume driver base class

This commit is to add two options in the volume driver base class.

We add 'api_server_ip' and 'api_server_port' for setting the IP
address and the port of the volume backend.

Change-Id: Idac6f57512a45262ac76c78c88c3b474409ab786
Implements: blueprint add-new-option-in-volume-driver-base-class

commit_message:
Start sequence at 1 for deploy steps playbook

We should start the sequence at 1 instead of 0, since all our puppet
manifests assume the first step is 1. Trying to run our puppet manifests
with a hieradata value of step=0 actually results in an error because no
classes are included.

Change-Id: I93dc8b4cefbd729ba7afa3a4d81b4ac95344cac2
Closes-Bug: #1717292
(cherry picked from commit 320f80dbae3bb7b8b57239a5da99c0020a7f8a12)

[{'created': '2017-11-28 08:47:18.000000000', 'message': 'run_tests_common.sh: Add more openSUSE packages

We need to explicitly pull the python-xml and ca-certificates-mozilla
packages which may not exist on really small openSUSE images. These
packages are needed for a functional SSL setup and also for being
able to run pip.

Change-Id: Ib518cff03dbfdbfa7c31729521c265e7a3e7e9cf
(cherry picked from commit c28727540d3c9ed0641d5052c67b4500aac330e9)
'}]
commit_message:
run_tests_common.sh: Add more openSUSE packages

We need to explicitly pull the python-xml and ca-certificates-mozilla
packages which may not exist on really small openSUSE images. These
packages are needed for a functional SSL setup and also for being
able to run pip.

Change-Id: Ib518cff03dbfdbfa7c31729521c265e7a3e7e9cf
(cherry picked from commit c28727540d3c9ed0641d5052c67b4500aac330e9)

Changes the selector used to assign the delete on
click action to the correct button in the modal
confirmation dialog.

In addition, the code that hides the "working"
modal to the success handler of said delete action;

commit_message:
Fixes the deletion on click action assignment

Changes the selector used to assign the delete on
click action to the correct button in the modal
confirmation dialog.

In addition, the code that hides the "working"
modal to the success handler of said delete action;
the modal should now appear while elements are
actually being deleted and disappearing after
the operation finishes.

Closes-Bug: 1733324
Change-Id: Ia14c263ed49c6f9705dbe12e8108a2c8c858aa31

commit_message:
Set host name explicitly for telemetry

Without this there could be a mismatch with other services like
nova and neutron and ceilometer wont find nova instances.

Closes-bug: #1721054

Depends-On: I421a61dc31bd10fec0a10bf7e867001cf4dd3f02

This adds extra args for the kube-scheduler to expose metrics on
port 10251 on all interfaces. This allows for Prometheus to gather
metrics for the scheduler

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-24 16:55:27.000000000', 'message': 'fullstack: Wait at least 3 minute for agents to report

Test runner polls neutron-server for agents for default value of
wait_until_true() which is 60 seconds. It has been proven to be
insufficient time on busy environments. This patch bumps the timeout to
3 minutes and also highers polling interval from 1 seconds to 10
seconds, to offload neutron-server.

Change-Id: I108176ee5668c2bc456dda1810aa509212e7cb38
Closes-bug: #1734357
'}]
commit_message:
fullstack: Wait at least 3 minute for agents to report

Test runner polls neutron-server for agents for default value of
wait_until_true() which is 60 seconds. It has been proven to be
insufficient time on busy environments. This patch bumps the timeout to
3 minutes and also highers polling interval from 1 seconds to 10
seconds, to offload neutron-server.

Change-Id: I108176ee5668c2bc456dda1810aa509212e7cb38
Closes-bug: #1734357

commit_message:
[devstack] stop setting or relying on standard properties

This change moves our devstack plugin away from using the old
scheduling properties: memory_mb, local_gb and cpus. Nova will
stop using them for scheduling in Queens.

The cpu_arch property is left intact, as it's still useful.

The Placement API is polled to determine when nodes are fully exposed
to nova instead of polling the hypervisor stats. cURL + jq are used,
as the Placement OSC plugin is not ready yet.

Change-Id: I497a992bd86e8a359f333d6936621d1136d68061

@ayoung The trust check using uuid token is redundant since a token is invalidated once a domain is disabled and it fast fails. Fernet tokens can't get invalidated so the trustee domain needs to be check. Currently master returns a valid 200 for fernet token even is the trustee's domain is disabled, this patch fixes that."}, {'account_id': 13152, 'date': '2016-01-07 22:58:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 27:

'}, {'created': '2015-12-09 19:49:09.000000000', 'message': "Reduce revoke events for disabled domains and projects.

Keystone's preformance degradates as the ‘revocation_event’ table grows
in size. This patch is the initial step towards reducing the number of
revocation events written the 'revocation_event' table. Instead of
creating revocation events when a project or domain is disabled,
keystone will explicitly do an enabled check to determine if a token is
valid.

Closes-Bug: 1524030

Change-Id: I76330567e0df2d9f2af88ef9b6b98b8c379e7406

"}, {'created': '2016-02-16 17:43:20.000000000', 'message': "Reduce revoke events for disabled domains and projects.

Keystone's preformance degradates as the 'revocation_event' table grows
in size. This patch is the initial step towards reducing the number of
revocation events written the 'revocation_event' table. Instead of
creating revocation events when a project or domain is disabled,
keystone will explicitly do an enabled check to determine if a token is
valid. Futhermore, this is just one step in a series of patches to
eliminate most revocation events, ultimately improving the performance
of Fernet token validation.

Closes-Bug: 1524030

Change-Id: I76330567e0df2d9f2af88ef9b6b98b8c379e7406

valid. Futhermore, this is just one step in a series of patches to
eliminate most revocation events, ultimately improving the performance
of Fernet token validation.

"}, {'created': '2017-08-09 15:33:23.000000000', 'message': "Ensure domains and projects are validated online

There has been an ongoing effort to improve the performance of
keystone's revocation subsystem. One way we can continue to improve
performance is by presisting few events to the revocation_event
table. As the table grows, it becomes more expensive to compare
token values to. We currently persist a revocation event when a
project or domain is disabled. Instead, a check can be performed at
token validation time to ensure the project or domain is enabled
instead of referencing the revocation event table.

Closes-Bug: 1524030

Change-Id: I76330567e0df2d9f2af88ef9b6b98b8c379e7406
"}, {'created': '2017-08-09 16:42:52.000000000', 'message': "Ensure domains and projects are validated online

performance is by presisting few events to the revocation_event
table. As the table grows, it becomes more expensive to compare
token values to. We currently persist a revocation event when a
project or domain is disabled. Instead, a check can be performed at
token validation time to ensure the project or domain is enabled
instead of referencing the revocation event table.

Closes-Bug: 1524030

Change-Id: I76330567e0df2d9f2af88ef9b6b98b8c379e7406
"}, {'created': '2017-11-24 23:12:33.000000000', 'message': "Validate disabled domains and projects online

Keystone's performance degrades as the `revocation_event` table grows
in size. This patch reduces the total number of events written to the
table by not persisting events when a domain or project is disabled.

The main reason for persisting a revocation event when a project or
domain is disabled is to make sure tokens associated to those targets
are considered invalid. Instead of relying on revocation events, we
can check if the project or domain is enabled when we validate the
token. We take the same approach when we validate a user's role
assignments instead of relying on an ever-growing database table.

Co-Authored-By: Lance Bragstad <lbragstad@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: 1524030
Change-Id: I76330567e0df2d9f2af88ef9b6b98b8c379e7406

The main reason for persisting a revocation event when a project or

are considered invalid. Instead of relying on revocation events, we

commit_message:
Validate disabled domains and projects online

Keystone's performance degrades as the `revocation_event` table grows
in size. This patch reduces the total number of events written to the
table by not persisting events when a domain or project is disabled.

The main reason for persisting a revocation event when a project or
domain is disabled is to make sure tokens associated to those targets
are considered invalid. Instead of relying on revocation events, we
can check if the project or domain is enabled when we validate the
token. We take the same approach when we validate a user's role
assignments instead of relying on an ever-growing database table.

Co-Authored-By: Lance Bragstad <lbragstad@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: 1524030
Change-Id: I76330567e0df2d9f2af88ef9b6b98b8c379e7406

commit_message:
zuul: Clean up zuul files

Changes to legacy-ironic-inspector-jobs.yaml:
  * Create two base jobs:
    * 'ironic-inspector-tox-func-base'
    * 'ironic-inspector-dsvm-base'
  * Put 'irrelevant-files' section into the new base jobs
  * Have 'requirements.txt' no longer be ignored for DSVM jobs
  * Simplify 'required-projects' sections by removing projects that
    are already pulled in by the 'legacy-dsvm-base' job.

Changes to project.yaml:
  * Move 'irrelevant-files' section from project.yaml to
    legacy-ironic-inspector-jobs.yaml
  * Remove 'branches' section from project.yaml as it is not needed.
  * Sort the jobs list

Change-Id: I6ef94a75fc9e1939c46b2939d01478c5a11621c1

commit_message:
[www-I18n] Updates landing pages with more docs

This patch updates language landing pages to include
more translated documents and links which have high
translated ratio (>75%):
- Install guides (>=Pike, Ocata)
- Image guides
- Network guides (Ocata)
- Releasenotes
- I18n contributor guide
- user-survey link

Also, deletes EOL-ed links to landing pages
which language team translated newer version of documents.

Change-Id: I4b5aa8fa2e328b5ba3eee9b9bcacad2b011bc4b1
Co-Authored-By: işbaran akçayır <isbaran@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Robert Simai <robert.simai@suse.com>
Co-Authored-By: chenxing <chason.chan@foxmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Suhartono <cloudsuhartono@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-28 08:43:06.000000000', 'message': 'Add package install assertions to SUSE base image

The SUSE base image is using ONLY the leap repositories by default. This
change provides access to the the tumbleweed repos at a far lower
priority giving deployers access to newer packages and features should
they need them without breaking typical LEAP support. One such package
being installed today is "systemd" which gives our container systems
access to systemd 234 which resolves numerous bugs and provides for
some of the mode advanced systemd built-ins we're looking to consume
elsewhere.

In developing this change It was discovered that the flag "--no-confirm"
was not being passed in, which can, in some circumstances cause the
zypper package manager to hang asking for user input. While this flag
is generally assumed given our other options passing it in to the
installation tasks will ensure we're never waiting for user input on
an automated base image build.

Change-Id: Ie214cbd77280321b1795e11020a72dc73cb70c62
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add package install assertions to SUSE base image

The SUSE base image is using ONLY the leap repositories by default. This
change provides access to the the tumbleweed repos at a far lower
priority giving deployers access to newer packages and features should
they need them without breaking typical LEAP support. One such package
being installed today is "systemd" which gives our container systems
access to systemd 234 which resolves numerous bugs and provides for
some of the mode advanced systemd built-ins we're looking to consume
elsewhere.

In developing this change It was discovered that the flag "--no-confirm"
was not being passed in, which can, in some circumstances cause the
zypper package manager to hang asking for user input. While this flag
is generally assumed given our other options passing it in to the
installation tasks will ensure we're never waiting for user input on
an automated base image build.

Change-Id: Ie214cbd77280321b1795e11020a72dc73cb70c62
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Provisioning Improvements

Spec to add support for standardized over-provisioning calculations and
make all drivers status reports consistent between different backends.

Change-Id: Ie709333d75fb8c1c4693eae7d09d7f4925dc3fca

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-12 08:32:13.000000000', 'message': "Don't overwrite binding-profile

Currently when providing existing direct port, nova-compute
will overwrite the binding-profile information with pci_vendor_info
and pci_slot. The binding-profile will be used to request
NIC capabilities for SR-IOV ports [1]. This also allows to distinguish
which neutron mechanism driver will bind the port [2].

This patch updates the behaviour that on update port it will update,
rather than overwrite, the binding-profile information with
pci_vendor_info and pci_slot. And on unbind port it will remove
only the pci_vendor_info and pci_slot from the port binding-profile
rather than unsetting the entire field.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/435954/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/499203/

Closes-Bug: #1719327

Change-Id: Id847949b4761d51a14e5c2f39552f60a47889aa9

This patch updates the behaviour that on update port it will update,

only the pci_vendor_info and pci_slot from the port binding-profile
rather than unsetting the entire field.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/435954/

Closes-Bug: #1719327

Change-Id: Id847949b4761d51a14e5c2f39552f60a47889aa9

[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/499203/

Closes-Bug: #1719327

Change-Id: Id847949b4761d51a14e5c2f39552f60a47889aa9
"}]
commit_message:
Don't overwrite binding-profile

Currently when providing existing direct port, nova-compute
will overwrite the binding-profile information with pci_vendor_info
and pci_slot. The binding-profile will be used to request
NIC capabilities for SR-IOV ports [1]. This also allows to distinguish
which neutron mechanism driver will bind the port [2].

This patch updates the behaviour that on update port it will update,
rather than overwrite, the binding-profile information with
pci_vendor_info and pci_slot. And on unbind port it will remove
only the pci_vendor_info and pci_slot from the port binding-profile
rather than unsetting the entire field.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/435954/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/499203/

Closes-Bug: #1719327

Change-Id: Id847949b4761d51a14e5c2f39552f60a47889aa9

commit_message:
SPICE native client support

Existing graphical consoles all use an HTML5 client through a
websocket proxy.  These consoles offer limited performance and do not
support the full range of features available with SPICE. To provide
users with an improved graphical console experience, this spec
proposes a new console type, spice-native, that will allow users to
connect to their server's SPICE console with a native client.

APIImpact
DocImpact

Spec for blueprint spice-native-client-support
Change-Id: I2a3d0a022186195c23c0b0d45d5f52ad85f2913b

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: Ibea5d36bcfa2fd0d58cc89a6cf15d702e119842a

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I01315f332e339bf783d34e96a972eac121816a56

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/517205/5/ : FAILURE in 3h 41m 02s'}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2017-11-14 04:19:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-11-15 22:01:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

You need to add the @wrap_instance_event(prefix='compute') decorator to the relevant methods in the ComputeManager to get the instance action events, otherwise you're just creating instance action records but never recording when the event starts and finishes, which is kind of the entire point of using instance action records in the first place."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-11-15 22:06:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-11-15 22:06:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Also, how about a release note?'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-11-15 22:08:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I suggest rebasing this on top of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/512190/ so they are in a series, otherwise you have conflicts in the instance_actions.py module.

And to avoid too many redundant release notes for all of the new actions you're going to add, start a release note in the first change in the series, and then use a list in the release note to add to it for each new action you add in subsequent patches. Then we'll end up with a single release note with a list of the new actions, rather than N release notes for N new actions which would clutter up the release notes docs."}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2017-11-16 01:57:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> I suggest rebasing this on top of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/512190/
 > so they are in a series, otherwise you have conflicts in the
 > instance_actions.py module.
 > 
 > And to avoid too many redundant release notes for all of the new
 > actions you're going to add, start a release note in the first
 > change in the series, and then use a list in the release note to
 > add to it for each new action you add in subsequent patches. Then
 > we'll end up with a single release note with a list of the new
 > actions, rather than N release notes for N new actions which would
 > clutter up the release notes docs.

Good idea"}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2017-11-16 02:02:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Add instance action record for attach/detach/swap volumes

We currently don't record volume attach/detach/swap instance
actions. This is useful for auditing and debugging.

This patch adds volume attach/detach/swap actions.

Change-Id: I0a3d15f3e3d0d8d920a79b519e17e3228e99f293
partial-implements: blueprint fill-the-gap-for-instance-action-records

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-17 03:59:38.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: Id6f88c2d016dee061992a9d3359c0d1f5d120a8f
"}]
commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: Id6f88c2d016dee061992a9d3359c0d1f5d120a8f

commit_message:
Update document related to host aggregate

The arguments of nova CLI commands related to host aggregate
(I93f44a12b6d5a91b448f6f8d238311d58bf40c01) are fixed.
The host APIs have been deprecated since microversion 2.43.
So remove description related to nova host commands.
And add description about nova hypervisor commands.

Change-Id: Ibf78865844da6f007b610f12430df4866076f00b
Closes-Bug: #1726658

subject: Mount /var/cache/swift across containers
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 6968, 'name': 'Christian Schwede', 'email': 'cschwede@redhat.com', 'username': 'cschwede'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 6968, 'date': '2017-11-24 06:17:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6968, 'date': '2017-11-24 09:05:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2017-11-24 11:12:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I'm nost sure this is going to work in the multiple concurrent writes from containers on a host"}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2017-11-24 11:13:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

could we use 'write one, read many' instead?.."}, {'account_id': 6968, 'date': '2017-11-26 11:26:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> could we use 'write one, read many' instead?..

No, that won't work. Most of the containers really need to write to these two files (object.recon and container.recon). And we're already doing the same on /srv/node - for example, object-server and object-replicator might also write to the same file.

AFAICT this patch works fine, running this since 3 days and all processes update the same object.recon/container.recon continuously without a problem."}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2017-11-27 15:03:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-11-27 21:27:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2017-11-27 21:28:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6968, 'date': '2017-11-28 15:24:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/pike as commit 6df937eef01b7943d052b9e418587360e729d119'}]

commit_message:
Mount /var/cache/swift across containers

This is needed to ensure all containers update the same cache file used
by swift-recon to collect health and debug data.

Closes-Bug: 1734268
Change-Id: Ia586cc6277359dcb1a78194d65eaa932dd995ed3

commit_message:
Consume a zaqar queue for update to poll ansible result

Consume the update zaqar queue to get the ansible output in
real time.
The queue used is not the 'tripleo' queue because we need
to not be disrupt by other messages.
We need to claim all the zaqar messages in the queue to
get a consistent ansible output

Cherry-Pick from bb52d24649358c2cbd11df2239afea8471f72b88
Change-Id: I3682051eb719f8da9c744f7ec8be3a58f3db3f86
Closes-Bug: 1732497

commit_message:
Deploy with --config-download even when some role has count 0

Roles which don't have any instances will not have a 'ctlplane' record
in the RoleNetHostnameMap, so we shouldn't be depending on it being
always present.

Change-Id: I2da025961c584cb1adc83943561b1d9faa3559b1
Closes-Bug: #1734703

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-28 13:44:01.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: logging configuration using YAML file

At now horizon and django users dictConfig().

fileConfig() allows us to configure logging with a separate file,
but according to the python document future enhancements will be
added to dictConfig(), so it looks like better to use dictConfig().

This commit propose an alternative to use YAML file for logging definition.
We can leverage merits of a separate file and human-readable formats.

As a possible future enhancement, we can apply JSON schema for
the logging YAML format validation to avoid wrong definitions.

[1] https://docs.python.org/3.6/library/logging.config.html#configuration-file-format

Change-Id: Ib9d9014e734eda9c972a379d40cca496c77e3782
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: logging configuration using YAML file

At now horizon and django users dictConfig().

fileConfig() allows us to configure logging with a separate file,
but according to the python document future enhancements will be
added to dictConfig(), so it looks like better to use dictConfig().

This commit propose an alternative to use YAML file for logging definition.
We can leverage merits of a separate file and human-readable formats.

As a possible future enhancement, we can apply JSON schema for
the logging YAML format validation to avoid wrong definitions.

[1] https://docs.python.org/3.6/library/logging.config.html#configuration-file-format

Change-Id: Ib9d9014e734eda9c972a379d40cca496c77e3782

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-27 10:38:09.000000000', 'message': 'Fix linters

These tasks have no changed_when:, and are command tasks.
We should give the conditions to mark these tasks as "changed"
or not.

Because these tasks are only read only tasks, we can assume they
will either fail (no special condition to handle there), or
will work and not change anything in the cluster.

Change-Id: Ib9f3111731d56443b121427b895ae9985b14fa3a
'}]
commit_message:
Fix linters

These tasks have no changed_when:, and are command tasks.
We should give the conditions to mark these tasks as "changed"
or not.

Because these tasks are only read only tasks, we can assume they
will either fail (no special condition to handle there), or
will work and not change anything in the cluster.

Change-Id: Ib9f3111731d56443b121427b895ae9985b14fa3a

[{'created': '2017-04-03 16:14:27.000000000', 'message': 'Factor out duplicated notification sample data

Versioned notifications are functionally tested against stored sample
data. Also most of the instance notitication shares payload structure.
Today we store a separate sample for every instance notification.
These samples store similar, mostly redundant data. When a new field
is added to the InstancePayload then every instance notification
related sample file needs to be modified. This leads to big and
redundant changes like I18af99479562e2fe5e74e6e1252b804b074fee58.

To remove the redundancy this patch proposes to use json references
in the sample files instead of copy pasting the same notification
sample fragment to every sample.

As a first step this patch introduces the new test-dependency called
jsonrefs in the notification testing. Then subsequent patches will
replace the the duplicated sample data with references to common
sample fragments.

This proposed resolved supports resolving the refs recursively so
a referenced json fragment can reference further fragments. However
the current implementation does not handle reference loops.
The resolver also supports overriding parts of the referenced
json fragment to support content customization needed in the next
patch.

commit_message:
Factor out duplicated notification sample data

Versioned notifications are functionally tested against stored sample
data. Also most of the instance notitication shares payload structure.
Today we store a separate sample for every instance notification.
These samples store similar, mostly redundant data. When a new field
is added to the InstancePayload then every instance notification
related sample file needs to be modified. This leads to big and
redundant changes like I18af99479562e2fe5e74e6e1252b804b074fee58.

To remove the redundancy this patch proposes to use json references
in the sample files instead of copy pasting the same notification
sample fragment to every sample.

As a first step this patch introduces a small json ref resolver.
Then subsequent patches will replace the duplicated sample data
with references to common sample fragments.

This proposed resolver supports resolving the refs recursively so
a referenced json fragment can reference further fragments. However
the current implementation does not handle reference loops.
The resolver also supports overriding parts of the referenced
json fragment to support content customization needed in the next
patch.

Change-Id: Ic3ab7d60e4ac12b767fe70bef97b327545a86e74

commit_message:
Ensure os-net-config conditional for upgrade doesn’t fail.

When using grep the check will fail if no upgrade is available.  This
has the side effect of not registering the variable and the check
later on will fail as “.stdout” property is not defined.

Using awk doesn’t have this side effect and will return empty stdout
without error in case of error.

Change-Id: I9d9bb3b625c2f0fb5f4a2c98bd3bf903f4bec176
Closes-Bug: #1733924
(cherry picked from commit aa8bf4b058c6340394be57522d0735e907fd3068)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-17 10:47:24.000000000', 'message': 'Add opendaylight to skydive

Skydive does not receive information about ovs
when odl is used instead of openvswitch.
Odl also deploys ovs.
Fixed some other issue:
- Useless config folder.
- Missing auth parm in analyzer conf.
- Set internal endpoint for connection to keystone.
- Remove stderr which consumes a lot of disk space in the host.
- Add sample conf for openflow when implemented in next
  skydive release.

Change-Id: I4f7287f7453a6c5b6b8d77d746281b175d421bed
Closes-Bug: #1711336

- Add logic to use skydive with odl
- Useless config folder.
- Missing auth parm in analyzer conf.
- Set internal endpoint for connection to keystone.
- Remove stderr which consumes a lot of disk space in the host.

Change-Id: I4f7287f7453a6c5b6b8d77d746281b175d421bed
Closes-Bug: #1711336
'}]
commit_message:
Add ovs flows to skydive

Skydive does not receive information about ovs flows
Fixed some other issue:
- Add logic to use skydive with odl
- Useless config folder.
- Missing auth parm in analyzer conf.
- Set internal endpoint for connection to keystone.
- Remove stderr which consumes a lot of disk space in the host.

Change-Id: I4f7287f7453a6c5b6b8d77d746281b175d421bed
Closes-Bug: #1711336

subject: Fix the deprecated syntax in 01-rewrite.conf
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-20 06:37:40.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the deprecated syntax in 01-rewrite.conf

The current syntax of Ubuntu fluentd rewrite rules are not supported
anymore, reference to this commit[1].
According to the build of this patch[2], The Centos has no such isuue.
Only Ubuntu needs to be upgrade to use the <rule> section.

* Centos use 01-rewrite-0.12.conf.j2
* Ubuntu use 01-rewrite-0.14.conf.j2

[1] https://github.com/fluent/fluent-plugin-rewrite-tag-filter/commit/248ed8e97def0a60121199c0d0e2fa8785f0d076
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/517907

Depends-on: ed669e22c830d7044c99891faf8ce9ae199f63b7
Change-Id: I0b131c2f65652cf3c61b33d8162097b047603923
Closes-Bug: #1730664
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the deprecated syntax in 01-rewrite.conf

The current syntax of Ubuntu fluentd rewrite rules are not supported
anymore, reference to this commit[1].
According to the build of this patch[2], The Centos has no such isuue.
Only Ubuntu needs to be upgrade to use the <rule> section.

* Centos use 01-rewrite-0.12.conf.j2
* Ubuntu use 01-rewrite-0.14.conf.j2

[1] https://github.com/fluent/fluent-plugin-rewrite-tag-filter/commit/248ed8e97def0a60121199c0d0e2fa8785f0d076
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/517907

Depends-on: ed669e22c830d7044c99891faf8ce9ae199f63b7
Change-Id: I0b131c2f65652cf3c61b33d8162097b047603923
Closes-Bug: #1730664

commit_message:
Extend retry times and decorated funcs for retry

The designate charm uses the designate client to create server and
domain objects during unit setup. This relies on the local designate
service and keystone being up and responding. This has proved racey
and this change extends the functions which have the retry decorator
and extends the retry count.

Partial-Bug: #1729231

Change-Id: I35162817afe3ff770f5a8781a29f3be1642687ba

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-26 13:01:37.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Add the ability to run the role on all hosts

We currently have spread out package/host management to multiple
roles, sometimes repeating ourselves in the process (see
pip_install and openstack_hosts overlap)

That is against Ansible principles, and we should have one role
that configures the minimum (to run openstack), applying it to
all the nodes, maybe behaving slightly differently depending on
some parameters. Here that parameter is if the host is a container
or not. If the host is a container, all the physical host
configuration (kernel and sysctl) is be skipped, the
rest of the configuration (packages/repos) still applies.

This needed a refactor to split the tasks into those two group
while remaining efficient and avoid multiple back and forth
of package installs/removal. For that last point, new defaults
variables were introduced, allowing overrides per host/group.
A node now member of a group x can now directly use this role
to setup all its necessary repos and keys.

Last, but not least, this override mechanism can now easily
trigger pip_install role, which can from now on, be removed
from every role. On top of that pip_install role can now
remove its repo management, and focus on installing pip on
hosts that don't have a proper version of pip installed.

Change-Id: Ibf145e561c80a12055bd4d5dca3914c4d495a748
"}, {'created': '2017-10-26 13:10:05.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Add the ability to run the role on all hosts

commit_message:
Add the ability to run the role on all hosts

We currently have spread out package/host management to multiple
roles, sometimes repeating ourselves in the process (see
pip_install and openstack_hosts overlap)

That is against Ansible principles, and we should have one role
that configures the minimum (to run openstack), applying it to
all the nodes, maybe behaving slightly differently depending on
some parameters. Here that parameter is if the host is a container
or not. If the host is a container, all the physical host
configuration (kernel and sysctl) is be skipped, the
rest of the configuration (packages/repos) still applies.

This needed a refactor to split the tasks into those two group
while remaining efficient and avoid multiple back and forth
of package installs/removal. For that last point, new defaults
variables were introduced, allowing overrides per host/group.
A node now member of a group x can now directly use this role
to setup all its necessary repos and keys.

Last, but not least, this override mechanism can now easily
trigger pip_install role, which can from now on, be removed
from every role. On top of that pip_install role can now
remove its repo management, and focus on installing pip on
hosts that don't have a proper version of pip installed.

Change-Id: Ibf145e561c80a12055bd4d5dca3914c4d495a748

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-27 23:17:10.000000000', 'message': "Cleanup pip packages

Packages which are already explicit requirements of or are only needed
for unit tests by keystone do not need to be mentioned within
keystone_pip_packages.

Also remove:
 - argparse included in Python 2.7's standard libraries
 - httplib2 no longer as of Ansible 2.1
 - python-ldap since ldappool requires pyldap, a Python 3 compatible
   fork
 - repoze.lru is already a dependency of keystone's Routes requirement

Change-Id: I3cc761aee039d05ef797340cde146089d2258e29
"}]
commit_message:
Cleanup pip packages

Packages which are already explicit requirements of or are only needed
for unit tests by keystone do not need to be mentioned within
keystone_pip_packages.

Also remove:
 - argparse included in Python 2.7's standard libraries
 - httplib2 no longer as of Ansible 2.1
 - python-ldap since ldappool requires pyldap, a Python 3 compatible
   fork
 - repoze.lru is already a dependency of keystone's Routes requirement

Change-Id: I3cc761aee039d05ef797340cde146089d2258e29

commit_message:
Remove yum-axelget from base image

This patch partially reverts https://review.openstack.org/#/c/521716/.

Package yum-axelget is not in CentOS or RDO repositories. Note
that installing packages from EPEL repos is not recommended when
deploying RDO.

Closes-Bug: #1734690

Change-Id: Id34e667673d0b4e20fe3fdd2a880a1769ec2a6c3

[{'created': '2017-11-21 10:35:03.000000000', 'message': "ansible-role-requirements: Switch ODL git repo to the github mirror

Cloning from the official ODL git repository fails far too often with
the following error

fatal: unable to access 'https://git.opendaylight.org/gerrit/p/integration/packaging/ansible-opendaylight.git/': gnutls_handshake() failed: Error in the pull function

Lets switch to the github mirror which may be more reliable.

Change-Id: Ib6a902a857739b34f94104d389e7cdbc9cc6c5d7
"}]
commit_message:
ansible-role-requirements: Switch ODL git repo to the github mirror

Cloning from the official ODL git repository fails far too often with
the following error

fatal: unable to access 'https://git.opendaylight.org/gerrit/p/integration/packaging/ansible-opendaylight.git/': gnutls_handshake() failed: Error in the pull function

Lets switch to the github mirror which may be more reliable.

Change-Id: Ib6a902a857739b34f94104d389e7cdbc9cc6c5d7

commit_message:
Added raw flag to regexp strings missing it

All regexp need to have a raw flag for the string so it won't be
interpreted. As it was right now it was working but reporting a
DeprecationWarning. This patch correct this trivial issue.

Change-Id: Ie6af7c44e0de0d24484ef4a837e3b9e51b7fc13e

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-28 08:14:57.000000000', 'message': 'Check and set cookie without using a failed task

Currently the checking of the cookie content uses
a try/rescue block and for a new install always
results in a failed task. This causes a lot of
confusion due to the failed task report.

This patch improves the process by executing the
stop/start if the cookie file is changed in any
way by the copy task. This is far simpler and
results in no task fails.

As all the tasks related to this were marked
rabbitmq-config the tag implementation is set
in the main tasks file and removed from all the
individual tasks.

Change-Id: Iba959f730f2453bf9a295158749b96ed3a966ef4
(cherry picked from commit b9205e831368baaee70f5b99f7e349db07ab7192)
'}]
commit_message:
Check and set cookie without using a failed task

Currently the checking of the cookie content uses
a try/rescue block and for a new install always
results in a failed task. This causes a lot of
confusion due to the failed task report.

This patch improves the process by executing the
stop/start if the cookie file is changed in any
way by the copy task. This is far simpler and
results in no task fails.

As all the tasks related to this were marked
rabbitmq-config the tag implementation is set
in the main tasks file and removed from all the
individual tasks.

Change-Id: Iba959f730f2453bf9a295158749b96ed3a966ef4
(cherry picked from commit b9205e831368baaee70f5b99f7e349db07ab7192)

Hi!  Thank you for submitting this.  I have some reservations, namely in that this seems to be boot related, and not deployment related.  Deployment is part of our workflow to achieve an operating machine, but it seems like if we're connecting remote iscsi storage via BMC, then that would be boot/management interface additions, and not a new deploy interface since the deploy interface effectively defines a new workflow. Given the commonality between workflows, I'm hesitant for there to be new ones, especially when there are a number of other conditions being met related to booting a remote volume. It seems like the simpler path is to focus on the transmutation of the attachment information to a BMC in the existing interfaces in order to make it a seamless functionality addition, especially given the opt-in nature of the storage interface.
-Julia"}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2017-05-16 07:03:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22: Code-Review-1

Also, the irmc driver is proposing something much less invasive to the conductor.
