procedural -2 since we are at spec freeze'}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2017-04-22 02:39:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: -Code-Review -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2017-06-09 20:18:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Code-Review-2

As of pike-2 keystone has entered specification freeze [0]. If you'd like to apply for an exception, please submit a request to the openstack-dev mailing list tagged with [keystone] and propose a discussion during keystone's weekly team meeting [1].

Placing a procedural -2 until Queens opens for development or an exception is granted.


[0] https://releases.openstack.org/pike/schedule.html
[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/keystone-weekly-meeting"}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2017-11-27 22:19:44.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
User self management of TOTP credentials

New API endpoints similar to the ones for ec2 access keys to
handle TOTP creation and management on a per user basis

Change-Id: I20869a409b58204552d84e36f867be89678f5c04

commit_message:
[WIP] Remove old method of creating a client

Remove the original method of creating a keystoneclient by passing your
authentication to it. All clients now take a session with auth plugin
that will handle authentication so this is no longer needed.

Change-Id: If4578a26aac5614d4c3beff89b8ab764a8607155

commit_message:
Move saml plugins to core

The saml auth plugins were in extras because they depended on a
non-standard library. Since the plugins now depend on only the
standard libary there's no need for the plugins to be in extras.

Change-Id: I7d4a1ae855d09b1bf511592765ccebdb78a21263

[{'created': '2015-09-10 02:13:38.000000000', 'message': "Add common options for loading an adapter

We now have session and auth plugin loading stable. Via the adapter we
have also tried to standardize the options that are provided to a client
init so the next step is to provide a standard way to load common client
options from CONF. CLI may also be useful but it's likely you are using
more that one client their so region and interface may not be
appropriate so ignore that for now.

Note: even though it's adapter in keystoneauth I think we may want to
rename all this to client loading as it's more correct for a user.

Change-Id: Id949edc49aa32170a1c7a53df6dce5c432259a3c
"}]
commit_message:
Add common options for loading an adapter

We now have session and auth plugin loading stable. Via the adapter we
have also tried to standardize the options that are provided to a client
init so the next step is to provide a standard way to load common client
options from CONF. CLI may also be useful but it's likely you are using
more that one client their so region and interface may not be
appropriate so ignore that for now.

Note: even though it's adapter in keystoneauth I think we may want to
rename all this to client loading as it's more correct for a user.

Change-Id: Id949edc49aa32170a1c7a53df6dce5c432259a3c

commit_message:
Provide combined register and loading functions

Now in __init__ we have a distinct way of specifying how to load a
plugin and a session from conf and from CLI. In most cases people are
going to want to use these together to fetch an authenticated session.

Provide a helper that wraps the standard usage of the session and auth
loading functions.

Change-Id: Ia80d65d6e6f02cbdf37c5367cf28fa1678922614

commit_message:
Fix networks abnormal display with trove show

According bug description, the networks display abnormal
when use trove show. The cause of the problem is method
_print_instance unformatted networks from result.

Change-Id: I30e27b731f67ab7c31e30af8ab9bb3e499e27dfa
Closes-Bug: #1734710

commit_message:
Make a new AuthToken object

We keep being bitten by the fact that the AuthProtocol object was
designed as a weird hybrid between oslo.config options and paste
options, and these assumptions don't hold up in newer projects.

We've also had problems recently with re-using the global CONF object in
tests where options are being left over between runs.

Redesign the primary middleware object so that it is in no way dependant
on CONF and then provide some loaders for compatibility. This would
allow new projects (and our tests) to do AuthToken.load_from_conf(conf)
to load middleware based on a specific config object.

It maintains compatibility with the old AuthProtocol object for people
using that directly - however I think we should also update the paste
hadler to use load_from_conf as well.

For now the AuthToken object is private as a new object opens up the
possibility of compatibility changes and lets us fix some option names
in later patches.

Change-Id: I25632e631df0bc98316ed76a7cc3f5cbff135a23

commit_message:
Closure table for HMT

Introduces a separate table to store hierarchical project structure.
For example, a tree consisting of a single branch is stored like this:
(id, parent, child, depth)
(1, A, B, 1)
(2, B, C, 1)
(3, A, C, 2)

Implements bp closure-table

Change-Id: I3f23b07a7c11bce4b127dd741acdc47e2558f867

commit_message:
Include pip install default repos

Install the same repos everywhere.
This allows the reduction of code in pip_install role.

Change-Id: I541287f906a143ed79553c69e1a9e39ee38dc8dc

subject: Fix 500 error when create trust with invalid role key
messages:
[{'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2017-11-24 04:43:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2017-11-24 19:56:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Couple suggestions/questions. Otherwise this is certainly on the right path. Thanks for the fix!'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2017-11-27 06:39:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2017-11-27 10:52:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

The heart of the issue here is that we have incomplete JSON validation. There's a note here about it:

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystone/tree/keystone/trust/schema.py#n39

If you follow the logic there, you can find that it doesn't validate the role object at all, any array will pass the validation.

This change to the schema validation should to the trick:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/627455/ (can also remove the note from Lance there)

This way you don't have to create a new Validation exception, it will all be covered by the normal schema validation code."}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2017-11-27 11:25:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2017-11-27 11:31:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > The heart of the issue here is that we have incomplete JSON
 > validation. There's a note here about it:
 > 
 > http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystone/tree/keystone/trust/schema.py#n39
 > 
 > If you follow the logic there, you can find that it doesn't
 > validate the role object at all, any array will pass the
 > validation.
 > 
 > This change to the schema validation should to the trick:
 > 
 > http://paste.openstack.org/show/627455/ (can also remove the note
 > from Lance there)
 > 
 > This way you don't have to create a new Validation exception, it
 > will all be covered by the normal schema validation code.

This is great!"}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2017-11-27 13:47:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2017-11-27 14:25:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2017-11-27 14:54:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

(2 comments)

Looks like this might need to be rebased on the latest patch set of the prior patch, but otherwise this looks great. Thanks for fixing!'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2017-11-27 15:11:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2017-11-27 20:06:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Fix 500 error when create trust with invalid role key

When create trust with invalid role key(neither 'id' nor
'name'), Keystone should raise 400 BadRequest, instead of
500 Internal Error.

This patch removed the redundant loops in
_normalize_role_list as well.

Change-Id: I62bd201c1dda7b573e2ee8b97322c1f25275892c
Closes-bug: #1734244

commit_message:
Add deploy guide link and release schedules

Re-arrange index to include more general info toward the top.

Re-order release note links in the index to be consistent, with
the latest at the top.

Add a summary description of each of the deploy references.

Fix broken link from find-us.html to Online Meetings.

Fix broken 'reviews' reference from how-to-contribute.html.

Change-Id: Id44d609d4e083b68c9a35db6798f59195a986906

commit_message:
Install NetworkManager to ensure consistent network bringup on centos

Sets up and enables NetworkManager.

In testing this was the only way to get the network to come up after
reboots on centos.

Change-Id: Iac8d982977982d886b29a8933b59dd3f55578769

commit_message:
Remove 'branches:' lines from .zuul.yaml

These are no longer needed and complicate queue definition
because of inheritance across branches.  Also remove
unnecessary 'voting: false' lines for experimental jobs
since they are by definition non-voting.

Change-Id: Iad5ab15a8166298e5e317d6c822d42c6cbb6e8ab

commit_message:
Add support for Dell EMC VMAX ISCSI Backend

This change adds a new define for cinder::backend::dellemc_vmax_iscsi

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-01 16:13:10.000000000', 'message': "required traits for no sharing providers

Adds filtering on a set of required traits to the
AllocationCandidates._get_by_filters() method, for deployments with no
shared providers that are involved in the request.

This patch should demonstrate where I'm heading with the breaking out of
the various SQL-related pieces into their own functions. The next patch
will add required traits support for scenarios with sharing providers.

Change-Id: Iac246245ef7aedfa2d23e623f83fdf384e252159

commit_message:
required traits for no sharing providers

Adds filtering on a set of required traits to the
AllocationCandidates._get_by_filters() method, for deployments with no
shared providers that are involved in the request.

This patch should demonstrate where I'm heading with the breaking out of
the various SQL-related pieces into their own functions. The next patch
will add required traits support for scenarios with sharing providers.

Change-Id: Iac246245ef7aedfa2d23e623f83fdf384e252159

commit_message:
Resolve ansible-lint test failures

With the merge of https://review.openstack.org/520177 in the
tests repo some ansible-lint failures which previously were
not being picked up are now detected.

This adds the appropriate skip tags to the tasks so that they
are not evaluated by ansible-lint.

Depends-On: I76157ccedfbcb8b0c2cba852bfa6b78ba6981c6c
Change-Id: I9f5c71aa896f25cfece39e080c74f99fb7be57b2
(cherry picked from commit 3e7377b4dfd8e5a2c4f6b24c7c23eae15e739096)

subject: Make osc-tox-unit-tips work on other repos
messages: [{'account_id': 2, 'date': '2017-11-26 20:52:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2017-11-27 19:23:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2\n\nSo simple...'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-26 20:52:07.000000000', 'message': 'Make osc-tox-unit-tips work on other repos

We want to run osc-tox-unit-tips on changes to os-client-config and
python-openstacksdk - but the tox role defaults to using
zuul.project.src_dir as the working directory. We want it to always be
the openstackclient source dir.

Change-Id: Ic7a49b79fb9141d9d0b8da40e10c85b107564edc
'}]
commit_message:
Make osc-tox-unit-tips work on other repos

We want to run osc-tox-unit-tips on changes to os-client-config and
python-openstacksdk - but the tox role defaults to using
zuul.project.src_dir as the working directory. We want it to always be
the openstackclient source dir.

Change-Id: Ic7a49b79fb9141d9d0b8da40e10c85b107564edc

commit_message:
Propose follow-on comments for unified limits

This change mostly consists of formatting changes that the author
can incorporate into the main document if they choose to. Many of the
changes are to the propose API section so that it will be easier to
copy/paste it into our formal documentation when the implementation
merges.

Change-Id: I27d4a4f291aea261af4994c1e35af64ba5bbc422

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-27 19:22:54.000000000', 'message': 'Remove yum-axelget with overrides in tripleo_kolla_template_overrides

Image build jobs for Master are failing after a commit merged
to include EPEL-based package yum-axelget. This review patches
the overrides to remove yum-axelget.

Change-Id: Id26b59b028a889f825ec3c648f656bfb8170eb59
Closes-Bug: 1734752
'}]
commit_message:
Remove yum-axelget with overrides in tripleo_kolla_template_overrides

Image build jobs for Master are failing after a commit merged
to include EPEL-based package yum-axelget. This review patches
the overrides to remove yum-axelget.

Change-Id: Id26b59b028a889f825ec3c648f656bfb8170eb59
Closes-Bug: 1734752

required for upcoming Barbican patches.

See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/519757/ for proof that 0.7.0

commit_message:
Bump PyKMIP to 0.7.0

This change bumps the PyKMIP min version to 0.7.0, which is
required for upcoming Barbican patches.

See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/519757/ for proof that 0.7.0
works with Barbican.

Change-Id: I2aad6eb1e3ad13755f985de634f25b7c431674fa

subject: Use cinder_services dict to identify cinder-api service name
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2017-11-23 10:15:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2017-11-24 17:47:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2017-11-27 16:25:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2017-11-27 18:27:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-23 10:15:10.000000000', 'message': 'Use cinder_services dict to identify cinder-api service name

Instead of assuming the name, we use the dict as a reference.
This means it will work, even if someone overrides the dict
for some reason.

Change-Id: I7adae469e725fd0de84d1c75161ceffbe0a63c3e
'}]
commit_message:
Use cinder_services dict to identify cinder-api service name

Instead of assuming the name, we use the dict as a reference.
This means it will work, even if someone overrides the dict
for some reason.

Change-Id: I7adae469e725fd0de84d1c75161ceffbe0a63c3e

commit_message:
Replace the native quickstart inventory with ansible-role-tripleo-inventory

- Inventory is a core feature of a virt provisioning tool. At the
moment, quickstart is pulling in art-inventory [1] via requirements.txt.
This patch is dumping art-inventory [1] directly into quickstart itself.
- Convert roles/tripleo-inventory/README.md in rst format.
- Remove some extra newlines at end of file.
- Remove unnecessary files and directory.

[1] - https://github.com/redhat-openstack/ansible-role-tripleo-inventory

Change-Id: I1f20a69ca13de99eda0d98a26c63c66524b22dc8
Closes-Bug: 1604517
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Route based RBAC Management Bulk API

Munges the roles, implied roles, and routes
data into a single, fetchable API

No RBAC enforcement is done in this commit.

blueprint token-verify-role-check
SecurityImpact
APIImpact

Change-Id: I63234ea8cbff639bdc9b4e9772c474b40a8a89d5
Co-Authored-By: Kristi Nikolla <knikolla@bu.edu>

hi, jian. Did you test it with pass a configuration_id when cerate redis instance. I check the code find that it just call "update_overrides and then restart, not call apply_overrides.

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17812, 'date': '2017-11-23 08:43:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 17812, 'date': '2017-11-23 08:45:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 17812, 'date': '2017-11-23 08:46:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 17812, 'date': '2017-11-23 08:49:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 17812, 'date': '2017-11-23 09:02:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 17812, 'date': '2017-11-23 09:17:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 17812, 'date': '2017-11-23 09:26:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 25113, 'date': '2017-11-23 09:35:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

It can workaround problems like creating redis instance with requirepass option. commit_message:
Fix create redis instance with new requirepass

When create redis instance with a configuration which has requirepass
value(not 'foobared'). Period task still use old password to poll instance's
status, so instance create failed because authentication error. Applied
requirepass at runtime and refresh admin client after apply_user_override
to fix it.

Change-Id: I27598a9031efcb74821f77c36710d224b3a9a0e6
Closes-bug: #1733815

The process for moving specs requires any stale information in the spec to be updated. Specifically the work that's going to be targeted for the release. This is a fairly general document that describes the entire workflow of the systems end-state. If we're going to consider any work for Pike, reviewers need to know exactly what we're planning on delivering in Pike as well as paint the picture for what we need to work on after that. The current spec doesn't do that [0]. There is a list of Work Items, but I can't tell which ones we're planning on working on for Pike. 

While the spec was merged, there were several outstanding comments from other contributors [1]. If we are re-proposing this to Pike, we should take the opportunity to cleanup those conversations (John had a bunch of comments that never got answered). I think that will help get folks on board and make sure everyone is on the same page.

I also don't think the assignee section is right, since multiple contributors in that list have had changes in priority or just haven't been around much. It would be worth following up with each of them to make sure they are actually able to contribute to this in Pike.



[0] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/ongoing/role-check-from-middleware.html
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/391624/"}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2017-04-04 12:46:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

All of them.  There are changes required in Keystone, client, and middleware.  This is not a huge amount of work.  We can do it all in Pike'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2017-04-04 17:55:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I have a concern regarding the upgrade case. For example:

- A service releases a new API with a default policy registered in code, the new policy requires the observer role by default
- The new service is rolled out during an upgrade
- Users with the observer role try to use the new functionality
- Requests to use the new service API fail because the URL pattern/role/operation doesn't exist in keystone, even if the observer role does.

The whole idea behind moving policies into code and formally documenting them was to make operators lives easier. This workflow doesn't help that story. Instead it puts even more burden on deployers and operators. If they wish to change the default, they have to now change it in two places instead of one. If the policy/operation in keystone is ever out of sync with the policy provided by the service (as the default or as an override), what happens? Does the keystone version take precedence over the policy defined in the service? One of the biggest issues with the previous implementation was that operators didn't care to manually diff policies files across releases when things broke. Now that we're working to get rid of that they have to diff their oslo.policy objects/policy overrides against something in keystone.

Do we have a list of operators that are OK standing behind this proposal, and it's upgrade cases?"}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2017-04-04 19:28:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2017-04-04 21:57:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Nice to make it out of scope at this time, just few comments.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2017-04-05 10:11:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(30 comments)

Sorry, I am on an old patchset here it seems.

There is a bit I would really like us to do... keystone middleware doesn't allow a request through to the service unless you are a certain set of roles, ideally those are controlled by a well known oslo.policy name, and if missing we default to allowing all requests through (for the first few releases, till we bump the major version). We could suggest adopting that as a release goal for queens.

The dynamic part I really don't like because of the all the pain I see that creating to operators (like myself). I don't like the multiple levels of policy checks all fighting each other. All seems really very messy to work with.

I could see new projects with simple and standard REST APIs could use middleware to enforce policy nicely. They could leave scope checks in the code (if they need them at all). If that could just feed of the regular olso.policy file, and there is a way to discover all the URLs that can be protected, I think we could get somewhere good for those projects. But for folks deeply invested in oslo.policy, we have too much strange API behavior we need to keep, and multiple levels of policy protection will make things even harder to understand than it is today.

I don't think this moves on the per user delegation system at all, but I could be missing something big on that front."}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2017-04-05 10:11:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Also, sorry I didn't get comments on the original version until after it was approved. I remember the call out to review it, just took a few days for me to get to it, and it was merged already when I got there."}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2017-04-05 12:05:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Published edit on patch set 3'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-04-05 12:10:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2017-05-31 19:47:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(11 comments)

I took another pass at this, but I doubt I captured all the concerns others have. I'd feel better moving forward if the following was addressed:

- Keystone stores operational keys instead of URLs and methods. I completely understand that this defeats the point of doing the check in middleware, but I think if we take this approach we do it in the service where it has to process policy for the scope check anyway. At that point the service knows it's doing a compute:create_server or compute:reboot_server action and it can ask keystone for the role required directly if there isn't a policy on disk. I think the possibility of things changing due to microversions or the opportunity for inconsistencies to happen across API versions and multiple URLs and methods mapping to the same operation is going to be painful for operators.
- I really don't think we should expose this API to end users. I think it should be available to services and administrators only. Multiple OpenStack services have expressed interest or have already started working on capability APIs. This feature would be a great way to supplement that effort but I don't think it should be *the* approach. A user might have the proper role for a specific operation in cinder or nova, but what if those services aren't configured to support it? Then the user ends up trying it only to see the request fail, which leads to frustration. I get that we need to fix that problem, but I think it needs to be fixed with the service. If this feature is a thing, then the services can query keystone for the information (i.e. roles and operations specific to the service) and remove any operations that aren't supported due to the service's configuration in that deployment. That way the user gets the information that they need and it is accurate from an RBAC perspective and from a service configuration perspective.

If you'd like me to take a stab at reworking this, I can propose my changes as a separate review."}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2017-06-20 00:44:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Patch Set 8 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-06-20 00:46:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Verified+1

commit_message:
RHEL/Update: replace wc by yum to check updates

Similar to I8bd89f2b24bafc6c991382b9eb484cfa9a2f8968,
use yum to check if updates are available during RHEL registration and
run upgrades only when there are some.

Change-Id: I42cd699d21cbec7d754edf1b8d83e75de0f2c7d9
(cherry picked from commit b336b45102a0201bb0e8f5c583697fa1083e232e)

commit_message:
Allow for update after RHEL registration

Adds the ability to perform a yum update after performing the RHEL
registration.

Depends-On: I70afa68fbc1d941b128fadcc1d25b4d3e4a88d8b
Change-Id: Id84d156cd28413309981d5943242292a3a6fa807
Partial-Bug: #1640894
(cherry picked from commit c4fd8286761a976ff22e331b7edfb742c7fc425a)

commit_message:
Create pre-generated fake subunit file

Return subnit file for tracking all failed jobs in openstack health
system, even if they didn't reach step of running tempest tests.

Change-Id: If6709390aa5f10d94e7be86e5cc3a5ab4236f472

commit_message:
Add role to setup any centos vm to look like nodepool vm

This role will clone the needed CI repos and make sure the
/etc/nodepool files are in place in order to run the toci
scripts on a cloud provisioned CentOS guest.

Change-Id: I7b0b3f27ee012583c22eb1a4372e61cda7a429f1

tasks: Remove unused apache configuration

The barbican role is using uwsgi instead of Apache so remove
the playbooks related to Apache and SSL configuration.

Change-Id: I58a2f3ecbcd6de0cc0d345e9f6f1bb1027c22c92

commit_message:
finish refactor AllocCandidates._get_by_filters()

This patch completes the refactoring of the
AllocationCandidates._get_by_filters() mega-method by splitting out the
remaining pieces of code that handle the construction of the
part-shared, part-non-shared allocation requests for when there are
sharing providers in a deployment.

The split-out _alloc_candidates_with_shared() is still a long, complex
method and I'll continue trying to reduce the complexity there and break
functions out of it further. I did uncomplicate a part of the function
with use of the itertools.product() function to replace a faulty use of
zip() against a list of allocation request resource lists.

Closes-Bug: #1730730
Change-Id: Ibcfd1a28f36d3c7ccd26fcc6386207e4a25300d4

commit_message:
Constraint ansible installation

Rally installs ansible, in an unconstrained way.

To pass linters, we skip the lint job on the test
shell command.

Change-Id: Ic830cf81b3cc691aafb7a97819e0ce68e48dd809
(cherry picked from commit 6fd0163fdac16867cb1fe93278ed0fb8acf9d743)

commit_message:
Fix rpm group for documentation subpackages

There needs to be at least two entries in a group, toplevel
groups are not allwed within SUSE.

Change-Id: Ida5d6a7ff3c9eef02f55db367b107432d1888686

commit_message:
Expose use_json logging option

It enables JSON-formatted logging from oslo.log.

Change-Id: I9a1b4f43826d060c56af6d42900da5e26060bc8a

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john@johngarbutt.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5754, 'name': 'Alex Xu', 'email': 'hejie.xu@intel.com', 'username': 'xuhj'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 7166, 'name': 'Sylvain Bauza', 'email': 'sbauza@redhat.com', 'username': 'sbauza'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Mann', 'email': 'gmann@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 8768, 'name': 'Chris Friesen', 'email': 'chris.friesen@windriver.com', 'username': 'cbf123'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-11-22 17:28:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2017-11-22 17:31:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

All seems correct, follows the previous pattern for a similar screw up.'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2017-11-22 17:35:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

My inclination is that this is a straight up bug, and the kind of thing we should just fix and backport. Especially as this is an administrative level function, and the people that have access to this API also probably have access to know exactly the code levels on the servers to be aware that they'll need a certain level of stable branch for this to work."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-11-22 17:36:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> My inclination is that this is a straight up bug, and the kind of thing we should just fix and backport. Especially as this is an administrative level function, and the people that have access to this API also probably have access to know exactly the code levels on the servers to be aware that they'll need a certain level of stable branch for this to work.

I didn't think about the fact this is an admin-only API by default, so I would actually be OK with backporting the 1-line fix, and we still have stable/newton around. That would definitely be less complication and paperwork than a new microversion for this."}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2017-11-27 02:56:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

For what it's worth, I agree that this is a straight-up bug and doesn't need a new microversion.

Currently the code simply doesn't match the documented behaviour."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-11-27 19:00:46.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Just going to fix this as a bug:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/523194/'}]

Add support for the "force" parameter back into the
"PUT os-quota-sets" API which was regressed in the 2.36 microversion.

APIImpact

Spec for blueprint fix-os-quota-sets-force

Change-Id: I54dc746f0d930f893490a7a13f80bb8a050a2b5f

commit_message:
Fix force parameter for os-quota-sets API

Add support for the "force" parameter back into the
"PUT os-quota-sets" API which was regressed in the 2.36 microversion.

APIImpact

Spec for blueprint fix-os-quota-sets-force

Change-Id: I54dc746f0d930f893490a7a13f80bb8a050a2b5f

commit_message:
Expose use_json logging option

It enables JSON-formatted logging from oslo.log.

Change-Id: If14563da6d259c68c8d5df97ba8802acfd1bbb83

[{'created': '2017-08-30 11:28:56.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Allow pre-installed DLRN

https://review.openstack.org/498074 switched DLRN installation to
"pip install". However, it lost the ability to use a pre-installed

This change adds this option back, using a task variable
(dlrn_pre_installed, false by default).

commit_message:
Allow pre-installed DLRN

https://review.openstack.org/498074 switched DLRN installation to
"pip install". However, it lost the ability to use a pre-installed
DLRN, which is useful for DLRN itself and used in a CI job to avoid
breaking TripleO with DLRN changes [1].

This change adds this option back, using a task variable
(dlrn_pre_installed, false by default).

[1] - https://softwarefactory-project.io/r/gitweb?p=config.git;a=blob;f=jobs-zuul/dlrn.yaml;h=21fd858b6b16ead6cd84850f2614fe3ee0f11f9f;hb=refs/heads/master#l113

Change-Id: Iee0d0cf3d7e3213aa14f91edd2e16afd3b3c8306

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-27 16:19:43.000000000', 'message': 'run_tests_common.sh: Add more openSUSE packages

We need to explicitly pull the python-xml and ca-certificates-mozilla
packages which may not exist on really small openSUSE images. These
packages are needed for a functional SSL setup and also for being
able to run pip.

Change-Id: Ib518cff03dbfdbfa7c31729521c265e7a3e7e9cf
'}]
commit_message:
run_tests_common.sh: Add more openSUSE packages

We need to explicitly pull the python-xml and ca-certificates-mozilla
packages which may not exist on really small openSUSE images. These
packages are needed for a functional SSL setup and also for being
able to run pip.

Change-Id: Ib518cff03dbfdbfa7c31729521c265e7a3e7e9cf

[{'created': '2017-11-03 16:50:40.000000000', 'message': "Change haproxy check to tcpka for ec2_api

EC2-API always returns HTTP code 400 if not properly authorized,
therefore httpchk is not working, since it's expecting an 200 OK.
Changing to tcpka for now, until EC2-API implements a URL that is
suitable for healthchecks.

Change-Id: Ic8ec8cdd4dc59e3768c06912ceb8a91b425b0a06
"}, {'created': '2017-11-03 17:03:50.000000000', 'message': "Change haproxy check to tcpka for ec2_api

EC2-API always returns HTTP code 400 if not properly authorized,
therefore httpchk is not working, since it's expecting an 200 OK.
Changing to tcpka for now, until EC2-API implements a URL that is

Change-Id: Ic8ec8cdd4dc59e3768c06912ceb8a91b425b0a06
"}]
commit_message:
Change haproxy check to tcpka for ec2_api

EC2-API always returns HTTP code 400 if not properly authorized,
therefore httpchk is not working, since it's expecting an 200 OK.
Changing to tcpka for now, until EC2-API implements a URL that is
suitable for healthchecks.

Change-Id: Ic8ec8cdd4dc59e3768c06912ceb8a91b425b0a06

commit_message:
Fix wrong logic for triggering os-net-config special handling.

We want the special upgrade to be trigger when the
os_net_config_need_upgrade is true.

Change-Id: I6da13ad8bc9675ea2a80006615f4dc98355182f9
Closes-Bug: #1734135
(cherry picked from commit fac92ba0e7c4e40db73864e44c81a17cdfad2325)

commit_message:
Added options central service

This patch adds workers, threads, default-pool-id options to the
central.pp as these options can be configured for designate-central.

Change-Id: I0635d5fd2ece7bca85fab772a055c999d6721c1a
Closes-Bug: #1539327
Co-Authored-By: Sharat Sharma <sharat.sharma@nectechnologies.in>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-09 10:39:57.000000000', 'message': 'WiP Add ansible deploy interface

this patch pulls the ansible deploy interface code
and related ansible playbooks and auxiliary files
from ironic-staging-drivers project into main ironic tree.

Documentation and devstack plugin changes enabling automated
testing of this interface will be proposed in followup patches.

Change-Id: I43f54688287953ccb1c2836437aea76236e6560b
Related-Bug: #1526308
'}, {'created': '2017-10-09 15:19:03.000000000', 'message': 'WiP Add ansible deploy interface

this patch pulls the ansible deploy interface code
and related ansible playbooks and auxiliary files
from ironic-staging-drivers project into main ironic tree.

commit_message:
Add ansible deploy interface

this patch pulls the ansible deploy interface code
and related ansible playbooks and auxiliary files
from ironic-staging-drivers project into main ironic tree.

As discussed in the spec, the use of ramdisk callbacks
(lookup and hearbeats) is now mandatory with this deploy interface.
Playbooks and modules were updated to require Ansible>=2.4,
and custom Ansible module for executing 'parted' was replaced
with usage of built-in Ansible module.

The custom Ansible callback plugin now uses journald logger
by default to adapt to the default DevStack setup.

Documentation and devstack plugin changes enabling automated
testing of this interface will be proposed in followup patches.

Change-Id: I43f54688287953ccb1c2836437aea76236e6560b
Related-Bug: #1526308

commit_message:
[ci] Use pseudo-random names for new resources

Random names of resources makes the task impossible to find a test which
doesn't clean resources after a launch.

This patch changes name_generate method to generate names including a name
of the test, which can be really helpful.

Also, the simple script that prints resources after test run is added.

Change-Id: Id3a743afb624dd4bf8ed3523a1916455fd93655a
